definition: superfluous/redundant/cumbersome/refers to a son-in-law living with wife's family

sentences.english: And let there be no mistake: The blood is definitely running right now on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 毋庸贅言，現在華爾街的確已經是血流成河了。
寫作清晰，務必精簡，避免贅言。

sentences.english: Is this yet another necessary tautology?
sentences.chinese: 這是另一種必需的贅言嗎？

sentences.english: Health care reform must happen this year.
sentences.chinese: 無須贅言，事不宜遲，這項改革年內一定會展開。

sentences.english: If investment was decisive the outcome would already be known.
sentences.chinese: 如果說投入決定一切，那麼結果本應已無需贅言。

sentences.english: The blood is definitely running right now on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 毋庸贅言，現在華爾街的確已經是血流成河了。

sentences.english: Needless to say, some tongues are more versatile than others.
sentences.chinese: 無庸贅言，有些語言更具多樣性。

sentences.english: The importance of talents has been no doubt.
sentences.chinese: 人才的重要性已經無庸贅言。

sentences.english: The first step toward verbosity is  improving your vocabulary.
sentences.chinese: 贅言的第一步要提高你的詞彙量。

sentences.english: Whatever you’re wearing, it goes without saying that it needs to be clean.
sentences.chinese: 不管你穿什麼，無需贅言，都必須穿戴乾淨。

sentences.english: Write clearly. Be concise. Avoid wordiness.
sentences.chinese: 寫作清晰，務必精簡，避免贅言。

sentences.english: Clean backgrounds, needless to say, are one of the key elements of a successful portrait.
sentences.chinese: 毋庸贅言，乾淨的背景是拍攝成功人像的關鍵因素。
寫作清晰，務必精簡，避免贅言。

sentences.english: Provides several verbosity levels for a better user experience.
sentences.chinese: 提供一些贅言水平給一種較好的使用者經驗。

definition: to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
